title: Liverpool face gruelling festive period with NINE games in a month
text:
Liverpool will have to endure a gruelling December schedule and face their squad being stretched to the limit over the festive period.

Jurgen Klopp's Premier League title chasers will have to play nine matches between December 4 and January 2.

Manchester City may glimpse a possible opening in the defence of their crown with the Reds battling an exhausting fixture list.

Liverpool face a tricky December and Jurgen Klopp's side will be stretched to the limit

LIVERPOOL'S BUSY DECEMBER: 4th: Everton (H) 8.15pm 7th: Bournemouth (A) 3pm 10th: Salzburg (A) 8pm 14th: Watford (H) 12.30pm 18th: Club World Cup Semi-Final 22nd: CWC Final / 3rd Place Play Off 26th: Leicester (A) 8pm 29th: Wolves (H) 2pm Jan 2nd: Sheff United (H) 8pm

The FIFA Club World Cup semi-final and then final or third place play-off will take Liverpool out to Qatar between December 18 and 22.

Just four days later, Klopp's men face an extremely tricky Boxing Day clash away against Leicester, a game Brendan Rodger's side will be motivated for after narrowly losing the reverse this month.

Three days after that, the European Champions welcome Wolves to Anfield and that week looks the most trying of the month.

Liverpool kick off their December matches with the Merseyside derby on home soil before facing Bournemouth away, then RB Salzburg in the Champions League on December 10.

Mo Salah and Co have a relentless fixture list to deal with over the course of the festive period

Then comes another home game against Watford before the Club World Cup kicks off.

On January 2, Liverpool face Sheffield United before then can have some recovery time for the first time in a month.

The healthy eight point lead over Manchester City in the Premier League has given the Reds some breathing room but their title credentials are likely to be severely tested over the festive period, particularly with any injuries picked up to key men.
description: Liverpool will have to endure a gruelling December schedule and face their squad being stretched to the limit over the festive period. They have nine games in just under a month.
